channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Oracle defused ‘the key risk going into 2026,’ BofA argues, but the market isn’t buying it

item.title: Bob Iger left Disney’s CEO chair just before Covid exploded. Will his second exit be followed by a plot twist?

item.title: Authorities Believe Savannah Guthrie’s Mother, Nancy Guthrie, Was ‘Taken Against Her Will’
item.description: Ms. Guthrie, 84, was last seen on Saturday at her home in Tucson, Ariz. A sheriff said that investigators were treating her disappearance as a crime.

item.title: Moltbook is scary—but not for the reasons so many headlines said
item.description: It is people's devil-may-care attitude to the risk of AI agents that ought to really frighten us

item.title: Disney’s new CEO Josh D’Amaro stands to make $45 million but he’ll also get something priceless—a ‘clean break’ with Bob Iger
item.description: Disney’s new CEO is getting something that could be a major factor in his success: clarity about who's in charge.

item.title: New ‘Project Vault’ critical minerals stockpile is ‘first step of many’ needed for U.S. to break China’s supply-chain chokehold
item.description: The new stockpile plans are compared the the 50-year-old Strategic Petroleum Reserve, created in response to the 1973 Arab oil embargo.

item.title: Woman Wins Malpractice Suit Over Gender Surgery as a Minor
item.description: In a legal first, a jury in New York awarded $2 million to a patient who said that doctors had deviated from accepted medical standards.

item.title: All About the Epstein Files
item.description: Everyone seems to have questions about the sprawling scandal, so we talked to a reporter who’s been following the case for years.
